task_text: Find me the least skilled person in German language (pick the one with more project work, if multiple match)

text_blocks: I'm logged in as a Corporate Leadership member, which gives me full read access. Now I need to find the least skilled person in German language (skill_german), and use project work as a tiebreaker if multiple people have the same minimum level.

The results show employees sorted by skill_german level from highest (10) to lowest. However, I see the lowest level in this result is 6. The task is to find the LEAST skilled person, so I need to search for employees with lower German skill levels. Let me search for employees with skill_german at level 1 (minimum):
No employees with skill_german at level 1. Let me check level 2:
I found employees with skill_german at level 2 (the minimum). Let me get all of them to apply the tiebreaker:

I now have all employees with skill_german at level 2 (the minimum level). There are 20 employees with this level. Now I need to find their project work (number of projects and FTE) to apply the tiebreaker. Let me get their project involvement using find_projects_by_employee for each:

project.name: Hygienic tank lining series
project.description: Development of solventborne and waterborne tank linings for Mediterranean Bottling syrup and water tanks.

project.name: Pre-treatment interface for e-coat line
project.description: Coating system tuned for CentraleAuto's pre-treatment stage feeding an existing e-coat line.

project.name: Cleanroom-compatible coating package
project.description: Coating package for Helvetic FoodTech equipment and adjacent cleanroom surfaces.

project.name: Fire-protection topcoat certification
project.description: Certification and testing programme for Iberia Construction fire-protection topcoat systems.

project.name: Hygienic flooring for processing area
project.description: Floor system for food & beverage processing lines with hygienic, washable finish.

project.name: Fast-cure floor system for cold warehouses
project.description: Fast-curing industrial floor system for cold and ambient warehouses applied by Benelux Floor Solutions.

project.name: Hygienic flooring for processing area
project.description: Floor system for food & beverage processing lines with hygienic, washable finish.

project.name: Depot steel refurbishment system
project.description: Coating system for steel structures in AlpineRail depot halls and maintenance pits.

project.name: HR – skills & wills data cleanup
project.description: Internal project to clean up and harmonise skills and wills data across the employee registry.

Now I have all the data. Let me analyze the employees with skill_german at level 2 (the minimum):

The tiebreaker says "pick the one with more project work". The employees with the MOST project work (since we're finding the least skilled):
- Giorgio Pellegrini (ayEi_045): 2 projects, 0.9 FTE
- Roberto Caruso (ayEi_046): 2 projects, 0.9 FTE

Both have 2 projects and 0.9 FTE total. Per the tiebreaker rules, if they're tied on projects AND FTE, I should use salary as the final tiebreaker (higher salary = more senior).

- Giorgio Pellegrini: salary 71000
- Roberto Caruso: salary 52000

Giorgio Pellegrini has the higher salary (71000 > 52000), so he is the answer.

input.message:
The least skilled person in German language (skill_german level 2) with the most project work is **Giorgio Pellegrini**. 

He has skill_german at level 2 (the lowest level in the company for this skill) and is involved in 2 projects with a total FTE allocation of 0.9:
- Lead on "Hygienic tank lining series" (0.5 FTE)
- Engineer on "Pre-treatment interface for e-coat line" (0.4 FTE)

Note: Roberto Caruso also has skill_german at level 2 with the same project count (2) and FTE (0.9), but Giorgio Pellegrini was selected as the tiebreaker based on his higher salary (71000 vs 52000), indicating more seniority.

summary: ok_answer: The least skilled person in German language (skill_german level 2) with the most project work is **G
